newsitem.title: USA: Fed seen on sidelines during intervention period.
newsitem.headline: Fed seen on sidelines during intervention period.

text.p: The Federal Reserve was expected to remain on the sidelines during its usual midmorning intervention period Thursday, though there was a chance it still faced an add need, economists said.

The Fed put on five-day fixed system repurchase agreements (RP) Wednesday in addition to an outstanding 14-day RP operation which together totalled just under $9 billion. In addition, $1.125 billion was added by last Friday's coupon pass and economists said that should be enough to address the Fed's add need this session.
However, economists at UBS Securities Inc saw a remaining add need and called for a round of seven-day fixed RPs.
Federal funds were trading at 5.19 percent, slightly below the Fed's current official target level of 5-1/4 percent.
